trans-unit.source: Understand your bill for Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Understand your bill for Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: The charges for Microsoft Azure subscriptions vary by rate plan.
trans-unit.target: The charges for Microsoft Azure subscriptions vary by rate plan.

trans-unit.source: Some rate plans, such as the Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN, include monthly credits that you can use on any Azure service based on your needs.
trans-unit.target: Some rate plans, such as the Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN, include monthly credits that you can use on any Azure service based on your needs.

trans-unit.source: Please note that up to 24 hours of latent usage from your prior billing period can be reported in your current billing period.
trans-unit.target: Please note that up to 24 hours of latent usage from your prior billing period can be reported in your current billing period.

trans-unit.source: For more information about consumption, usage, and rate plans, see the [Microsoft Azure Purchase Options page](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/).
trans-unit.target: For more information about consumption, usage, and rate plans, see the [Microsoft Azure Purchase Options page](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/).

trans-unit.source: This topic helps you with the following tasks when reading your bill.
trans-unit.target: This topic helps you with the following tasks when reading your bill.

trans-unit.source: View or Download a Bill for Azure
trans-unit.target: View or Download a Bill for Azure

trans-unit.source: View or download a bill for Microsoft Azure:
trans-unit.target: View or download a bill for Microsoft Azure:

trans-unit.source: In the [Usage and Billing Portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/subscriptions) you can view current and download past bills.
trans-unit.target: In the [Usage and Billing Portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/subscriptions) you can view current and download past bills.

trans-unit.source: To view or download a bill:
trans-unit.target: To view or download a bill:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Usage and Billing Portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/subscriptions) using your Microsoft Account ID or Work or School Account ID.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Usage and Billing Portal](https://account.windowsazure.com/subscriptions) using your Microsoft Account ID or Work or School Account ID.

trans-unit.source: Click on the subscription in which you would like to see details and usage.
trans-unit.target: Click on the subscription in which you would like to see details and usage.

trans-unit.source: The **Billing History** section lists your statements for the last six billing periods plus the current unbilled period.
trans-unit.target: The **Billing History** section lists your statements for the last six billing periods plus the current unbilled period.

trans-unit.source: The statement for the current period is an estimate of your charges as of the time the estimate was generated.
trans-unit.target: The statement for the current period is an estimate of your charges as of the time the estimate was generated.

trans-unit.source: This information is only updated daily and may not include all of your usage incurred to date.
trans-unit.target: This information is only updated daily and may not include all of your usage incurred to date.

trans-unit.source: Your monthly bill may differ from this estimate.
trans-unit.target: Your monthly bill may differ from this estimate.

trans-unit.source: Click **View Current Statement** to view an estimate of your charges as of the time the estimate was generated.
trans-unit.target: Click **View Current Statement** to view an estimate of your charges as of the time the estimate was generated.

trans-unit.source: This information is only updated daily and may not include all of your usage incurred to date.
trans-unit.target: This information is only updated daily and may not include all of your usage incurred to date.

trans-unit.source: Your monthly bill may differ from this estimate.
trans-unit.target: Your monthly bill may differ from this estimate.

trans-unit.source: Click **Download Invoice** to view a copy of your previous bill.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download Invoice** to view a copy of your previous bill.

trans-unit.source: Below are some sample statements for two different offers available on Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Below are some sample statements for two different offers available on Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Spend deducted from your prepaid commitment
trans-unit.target: Spend deducted from your prepaid commitment

trans-unit.source: The customer information section identifies pertinent information in regards to your usage and profile.
trans-unit.target: The customer information section identifies pertinent information in regards to your usage and profile.

trans-unit.source: A unique invoice identifier for tracking purposes.
trans-unit.target: A unique invoice identifier for tracking purposes.

trans-unit.source: The time frame in which usage has taken place.
trans-unit.target: The time frame in which usage has taken place.

trans-unit.source: Date that the invoice was generated.
trans-unit.target: Date that the invoice was generated.

trans-unit.source: Type of payment used on the account (i.e. Invoice or Credit Card).
trans-unit.target: Type of payment used on the account (i.e. Invoice or Credit Card).

trans-unit.source: Type of subscription offer that was purchased (i.e. Pay-As-You-Go, MSDN-Vidual Studio Ultimate, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Type of subscription offer that was purchased (i.e. Pay-As-You-Go, MSDN-Vidual Studio Ultimate, etc.)

trans-unit.source: The account email address that the Microsoft Azure account is registered under.
trans-unit.target: The account email address that the Microsoft Azure account is registered under.

trans-unit.source: The Invoice Summary section of the bill summarizes transactions since your last bill and your current usage charges.
trans-unit.target: The Invoice Summary section of the bill summarizes transactions since your last bill and your current usage charges.

trans-unit.source: The Balances, Payments & Other Credits section of the bill summarizes transactions since your last bill.
trans-unit.target: The Balances, Payments & Other Credits section of the bill summarizes transactions since your last bill.

trans-unit.source: Previous balance is the total amount due from your last bill.
trans-unit.target: Previous balance is the total amount due from your last bill.

trans-unit.source: Payments are your total payments applied to your last bill.
trans-unit.target: Payments are your total payments applied to your last bill.

trans-unit.source: Any bill adjustments (credits or balances) applied to your account since your last bill.
trans-unit.target: Any bill adjustments (credits or balances) applied to your account since your last bill.

trans-unit.source: The Current Charges section of the bill contains details about your monthly charges.
trans-unit.target: The Current Charges section of the bill contains details about your monthly charges.

trans-unit.source: The links are organized into the following subsections.
trans-unit.target: The links are organized into the following subsections.

trans-unit.source: Usage charges are total monthly charges on a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Usage charges are total monthly charges on a subscription.

trans-unit.source: You are billed in arrears for your past month’s usage.
trans-unit.target: You are billed in arrears for your past month’s usage.

trans-unit.source: Service discounts on your usage would be reflected in this line item that are applied to your current bill.
trans-unit.target: Service discounts on your usage would be reflected in this line item that are applied to your current bill.

trans-unit.source: Miscellaneous adjustments are miscellaneous credits or outstanding charges applied to your current bill.
trans-unit.target: Miscellaneous adjustments are miscellaneous credits or outstanding charges applied to your current bill.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have the Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN offer, you would see a monthly credit in this line item.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have the Visual Studio Ultimate with MSDN offer, you would see a monthly credit in this line item.

trans-unit.source: If you cancel your subscription, you would see charges for monthly usage in excess of the monthly credit included in your offer from the start of your current billing period to your subscription cancellation date.
trans-unit.target: If you cancel your subscription, you would see charges for monthly usage in excess of the monthly credit included in your offer from the start of your current billing period to your subscription cancellation date.

trans-unit.source: The additional information page gives you references to other resources to understand your invoice, and links to view your usage as well as other relevant information for your bill.
trans-unit.target: The additional information page gives you references to other resources to understand your invoice, and links to view your usage as well as other relevant information for your bill.

trans-unit.source: A link in the description under Detailed Usage directs you the Azure Usage and Billing Portal where you can view your detailed usage for this subscription.
trans-unit.target: A link in the description under Detailed Usage directs you the Azure Usage and Billing Portal where you can view your detailed usage for this subscription.

trans-unit.source: There are now two versions available to download: **.csv version 1** contains the old naming convention and usage fields and **.csv version 2** contains customer friendly names for each of the categories plus additional fields that will help you understand what services you are using on Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: There are now two versions available to download: **.csv version 1** contains the old naming convention and usage fields and **.csv version 2** contains customer friendly names for each of the categories plus additional fields that will help you understand what services you are using on Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: This section has links to simple questions regarding compute instance sizes, SQL DB charges, and useful links to help you answer further questions.
trans-unit.target: This section has links to simple questions regarding compute instance sizes, SQL DB charges, and useful links to help you answer further questions.

trans-unit.source: This is prepopulated with the profile address on the account.
trans-unit.target: This is prepopulated with the profile address on the account.

trans-unit.source: This section is the payment instructions of where to send checks, wire transfers or overnight checks if your payment method is invoice.
trans-unit.target: This section is the payment instructions of where to send checks, wire transfers or overnight checks if your payment method is invoice.

trans-unit.source: As part of our ongoing commitment to help customers easily manage their Azure use, we've enhanced the download usage file that reports on your Azure services usage and costs.
trans-unit.target: As part of our ongoing commitment to help customers easily manage their Azure use, we've enhanced the download usage file that reports on your Azure services usage and costs.

trans-unit.source: The download link contains two versions of the usage file: **Version 1** uses the pre-existing format; **Version 2** includes additional information and updated column names in the Daily Usage section.
trans-unit.target: The download link contains two versions of the usage file: **Version 1** uses the pre-existing format; **Version 2** includes additional information and updated column names in the Daily Usage section.

trans-unit.source: Usage charges are total **monthly** charges on a subscription less any credit or discount.
trans-unit.target: Usage charges are total **monthly** charges on a subscription less any credit or discount.

trans-unit.source: You are billed in arrears for your past month’s usage.
trans-unit.target: You are billed in arrears for your past month’s usage.

trans-unit.source: The top section of the file display the details on the services you are being billed for during the previous month's billing cycle.
trans-unit.target: The top section of the file display the details on the services you are being billed for during the previous month's billing cycle.

trans-unit.source: The table below lists the names of the columns for each of the .csv version files.
trans-unit.target: The table below lists the names of the columns for each of the .csv version files.

trans-unit.source: The billing period when the resource was consumed.
trans-unit.target: The billing period when the resource was consumed.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the top-level service for which this usage belongs.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the top-level service for which this usage belongs.

trans-unit.source: Azure service may be further defined by type in this column, which can affect the rate.
trans-unit.target: Azure service may be further defined by type in this column, which can affect the rate.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the unit of measure for the resource being consumed.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the unit of measure for the resource being consumed.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the location of the datacenter for certain services that are priced based on datacenter location.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the location of the datacenter for certain services that are priced based on datacenter location.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the unique system identifier for each Azure resource.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the unique system identifier for each Azure resource.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the Unit that the service is charged in.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the Unit that the service is charged in.

trans-unit.source: Contains the amount of the resource that has been consumed during the billing period.
trans-unit.target: Contains the amount of the resource that has been consumed during the billing period.

trans-unit.source: Contains the amount of the resource that is included at no charge in your current billing period.
trans-unit.target: Contains the amount of the resource that is included at no charge in your current billing period.

trans-unit.source: If the Consumed amount exceeds the included amount, this column displays the difference.
trans-unit.target: If the Consumed amount exceeds the included amount, this column displays the difference.

trans-unit.source: You are billed for this amount.
trans-unit.target: You are billed for this amount.

trans-unit.source: For Pay-As-You-Go offers with no amount included with the offer, this total will be the same as the Consumed quantity.
trans-unit.target: For Pay-As-You-Go offers with no amount included with the offer, this total will be the same as the Consumed quantity.

trans-unit.source: Contains the resource charges that are decremented from your commitment amount associated with your 6 or 12 month offer.
trans-unit.target: Contains the resource charges that are decremented from your commitment amount associated with your 6 or 12 month offer.

trans-unit.source: Note that your resource charges are decremented from your commitment amount in chronological order.
trans-unit.target: Note that your resource charges are decremented from your commitment amount in chronological order.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the currency reflected in your current billing period.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the currency reflected in your current billing period.

trans-unit.source: Contains the resource charges that exceed your commitment amount associated with your 6 or 12 month offer.
trans-unit.target: Contains the resource charges that exceed your commitment amount associated with your 6 or 12 month offer.

trans-unit.source: Contains the commitment rate based on your total commitment amount associated with your 6 or 12 month offer.
trans-unit.target: Contains the commitment rate based on your total commitment amount associated with your 6 or 12 month offer.

trans-unit.source: Rate displays the rate you are charged per billable unit.
trans-unit.target: Rate displays the rate you are charged per billable unit.

trans-unit.source: Displays the result of multiplying the Billable column by the Rate column.
trans-unit.target: Displays the result of multiplying the Billable column by the Rate column.

trans-unit.source: If the Consumed amount does not exceed the included amount, there will be no charge in this column.
trans-unit.target: If the Consumed amount does not exceed the included amount, there will be no charge in this column.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your usage, there can be thousands of rows of daily usage data.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your usage, there can be thousands of rows of daily usage data.

trans-unit.source: If you want to analyze this data, click **Download Usage** and choose a comma-separated variable file (.csv) version to see your daily usage data for the appropriate billing period.
trans-unit.target: If you want to analyze this data, click **Download Usage** and choose a comma-separated variable file (.csv) version to see your daily usage data for the appropriate billing period.

trans-unit.source: For your reference, you can download a sample .csv file for each version below.
trans-unit.target: For your reference, you can download a sample .csv file for each version below.

trans-unit.source: In the .csv file, the items are broken down to display a list of how much of each resource was consumed within the current billing period.
trans-unit.target: In the .csv file, the items are broken down to display a list of how much of each resource was consumed within the current billing period.

trans-unit.source: The following columns display details that affect the rates at the beginning of the billing period:
trans-unit.target: The following columns display details that affect the rates at the beginning of the billing period:

trans-unit.source: The date when the resource was emitted.
trans-unit.target: The date when the resource was emitted.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the top-level service for which this usage belongs.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the top-level service for which this usage belongs.

trans-unit.source: This is used as the identifier used to price billing usage.
trans-unit.target: This is used as the identifier used to price billing usage.

trans-unit.source: Azure service may be further defined by type in this column, which can affect the rate.
trans-unit.target: Azure service may be further defined by type in this column, which can affect the rate.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the unit of measure for the resource being consumed.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the unit of measure for the resource being consumed.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the location of the datacenter for certain services that are priced based on datacenter location.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the location of the datacenter for certain services that are priced based on datacenter location.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the Unit that the service is charged in.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the Unit that the service is charged in.

trans-unit.source: Contains the amount of the resource that has been consumed for that day.
trans-unit.target: Contains the amount of the resource that has been consumed for that day.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the datacenter where the resource is running.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the datacenter where the resource is running.

trans-unit.source: This column is utilized to track the individual Azure platform service that may not be specifically identified in the Name column.
trans-unit.target: This column is utilized to track the individual Azure platform service that may not be specifically identified in the Name column.

trans-unit.source: This Service column will indicate which specific service the usage pertains.
trans-unit.target: This Service column will indicate which specific service the usage pertains.

trans-unit.source: _**New column addition.**_ The resource group in which the deployed resource is running in.
trans-unit.target: _**New column addition.**_ The resource group in which the deployed resource is running in.

trans-unit.source: The identifier for the running resource.
trans-unit.target: The identifier for the running resource.

trans-unit.source: The identifier contains the name you specify for the resource when it was created.
trans-unit.target: The identifier contains the name you specify for the resource when it was created.

trans-unit.source: _**New column addition.**_ New resource types in Azure allow you to tag resources.
trans-unit.target: _**New column addition.**_ New resource types in Azure allow you to tag resources.

trans-unit.source: Additional metadata related to the service.
trans-unit.target: Additional metadata related to the service.

trans-unit.source: This column provides the project name that the service belongs to on your subscription.
trans-unit.target: This column provides the project name that the service belongs to on your subscription.

trans-unit.source: This is a legacy field that captures optional service specific metadata.
trans-unit.target: This is a legacy field that captures optional service specific metadata.

trans-unit.source: In addition to some new fields and name changes to csv Version 2, there will be standardized formatting for the data in the below fields:
trans-unit.target: In addition to some new fields and name changes to csv Version 2, there will be standardized formatting for the data in the below fields:

trans-unit.source: **Instance ID**: The Instance ID field represents the user specified identifier for the service provisioned.
trans-unit.target: **Instance ID**: The Instance ID field represents the user specified identifier for the service provisioned.

trans-unit.source: Currently, there are two formats in which the Instance ID is represented: it is either the name of the Resource or the fully qualified Resource ID.
trans-unit.target: Currently, there are two formats in which the Instance ID is represented: it is either the name of the Resource or the fully qualified Resource ID.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure services are transitioning to represent the Instance ID in a standardized fully qualified Resource ID format _**(/subscriptions/<subscription id>/resourcegroups/<resourcegroupname>/providers/<providername>/<resourcename>)**_.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure services are transitioning to represent the Instance ID in a standardized fully qualified Resource ID format _**(/subscriptions/<subscription id>/resourcegroups/<resourcegroupname>/providers/<providername>/<resourcename>)**_.

trans-unit.source: As services transition to the new format you will see the Instance ID data field change from just the resource name to Resource ID.
trans-unit.target: As services transition to the new format you will see the Instance ID data field change from just the resource name to Resource ID.

trans-unit.source: The Resource ID is the format used by the [Azure Resource Manager API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790567.aspx) to identify resources in an a subscription.
trans-unit.target: The Resource ID is the format used by the [Azure Resource Manager API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790567.aspx) to identify resources in an a subscription.

trans-unit.source: **Additional Info**: The Additional Info column in the usage .csv specifies service specific metadata.
trans-unit.target: **Additional Info**: The Additional Info column in the usage .csv specifies service specific metadata.

trans-unit.source: For example, an image type for a VM.
trans-unit.target: For example, an image type for a VM.

trans-unit.source: Currently, a service emits service specific metadata in multiple columns: Additional Info, Service Info1, and Service Info 2 fields.
trans-unit.target: Currently, a service emits service specific metadata in multiple columns: Additional Info, Service Info1, and Service Info 2 fields.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure services will be standardizing emitting service specific metadata in the Additional Info column only.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure services will be standardizing emitting service specific metadata in the Additional Info column only.

trans-unit.source: See the below snapshot of the standardized format:
trans-unit.target: See the below snapshot of the standardized format:

trans-unit.source: **Tags**: This column contains the user specified resource tags.
trans-unit.target: **Tags**: This column contains the user specified resource tags.

trans-unit.source: The tags can be used to group billing records.
trans-unit.target: The tags can be used to group billing records.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use tags to distribute costs by department using the service.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use tags to distribute costs by department using the service.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [using tags to organize Azure Resources](/resource-group-using-tags.md/).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [using tags to organize Azure Resources](/resource-group-using-tags.md/).

trans-unit.source: Services that support emitting tags are:
trans-unit.target: Services that support emitting tags are:

trans-unit.source: Networking services provisioned using the [Azure Resource Manager API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790567.aspx)
trans-unit.target: Networking services provisioned using the [Azure Resource Manager API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790567.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Please see these additional sources for more details on each service.
trans-unit.target: Please see these additional sources for more details on each service.

trans-unit.source: These files are updated on a monthly basis, published on the 25th for the coming month, and are available from **May 2015** onwards for .csv Version 1, and from **June 2015** onward for .csv Version 2.
trans-unit.target: These files are updated on a monthly basis, published on the 25th for the coming month, and are available from **May 2015** onwards for .csv Version 1, and from **June 2015** onward for .csv Version 2.

trans-unit.source: Below is the base file URL for the Service Download Fields:
trans-unit.target: Below is the base file URL for the Service Download Fields:

trans-unit.source: To find the most current version, enter in the Year and Month (looking for May 2015 file, enter in **052015** into the section _**“MMYYYY”**_ in the above URL).
trans-unit.target: To find the most current version, enter in the Year and Month (looking for May 2015 file, enter in **052015** into the section _**“MMYYYY”**_ in the above URL).

trans-unit.source: This spreadsheet provides a listing of all possible combinations of the service related fields in the **Usage Download Report**.
trans-unit.target: This spreadsheet provides a listing of all possible combinations of the service related fields in the **Usage Download Report**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the section, **Manage Accounts, Subscriptions, and Admin Roles**, under [Manage your services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn578292.aspx) for some very helpful links:
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the section, **Manage Accounts, Subscriptions, and Admin Roles**, under [Manage your services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn578292.aspx) for some very helpful links:

trans-unit.source: Edit payment information for an existing credit card
trans-unit.target: Edit payment information for an existing credit card

trans-unit.source: Add a new credit card to use as a payment method
trans-unit.target: Add a new credit card to use as a payment method

trans-unit.source: Change the credit card on your Microsoft Azure account
trans-unit.target: Change the credit card on your Microsoft Azure account

trans-unit.source: What do I do if my Azure subscription become disabled?
trans-unit.target: What do I do if my Azure subscription become disabled?
